intro: Alyssum pintodasilvae, commonly known as the Pinto da Silva alyssum, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
